Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2008 06:24PM Princess1214 wrote: Ok, I got home and checked out my mammogram report again.  It had a Catagory 3 on the bottom of the form...I totally missed it, I guess I was expecting it to say BIRADs.  Wishiwere...that is strange..  I hope you are doing well.  This whole thing makes me nervous.  You'd think I would be a little more knowlegeable about this stuff since my mother had been a 16 year survior.  But now I know I actually new very little of what type of cancer she had.  I've begun a binder with my results of my mammo and mri so that I can keep acurate records for myself and my daughter (she's only 10, but could be valuable info for her...hopefuly she will never need it although my mother-in-law is also a survior...now that I'm thinking of it, I need to get her to sit with me to discuss her dx).  Thank you again.
Posts.Title: When do they assign a Birads Score Princess1214 Princess1214

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2008 10:25AM Princess1214 wrote: Thank you for your replies ladies.  I just wasn't sure.  Elizabeth
Posts.Title: When do they assign a Birads Score Princess1214 Princess1214

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2008 02:57AM Princess1214 wrote: Hi everyone, I'm new to this post.  Last month I had a bilateral done for my yearly (it just so happend to coincide with my 6 month follow up for cysts in left breast).  They found more cysts and the found calcifications in my right breast.  So they said to follow up in 6 months.  That did not sit well with me as I just lost my mother in 2005 to bc (she had it reaccuring (3 times) for 16 years - mom was a fighter).  Anyway, I didn't even know that they were micro and that there were 6 clusters until I called my Gyno for the results.  No one gave me an explanation while I had the mamo...just come back in 6 months.  Well I went ahead and scheduled an appoitment with a surgeon (after speaking to my Gyno) to possibly have biopsies.  The surgeon suggested that since there were 6 areas that we should have an MRI done (on both breasts) and that at this time it would be difficult, not to mention painful to biopsy 6 areas, which I was ok with that for now.  I go for the MRI this Friday.  I've just been a nervous wreck since I heard this new information.  I've read that most are benign, but somehow I just can't find my comfort level yet.  I think I was more upset that they just send you on your way without any explanation...come back in 6 months there were some calcifications.  I had to get on the internet to read up on them.  I also don't think it would have hit me the way it did if they said only one area, but six areas sent my radar up.
Posts.Title: Breast Calcifications azcamm Makratz

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 08:11PM Princess1214 wrote: Sheila and Texasmom, Thank you so much for your posts...as my kids would say, "You Rock"!!!  This discussion board is full of helpful information.  Eventhough I am not in the position as most of the posts on this board, I appreciate each and every one of you and your willingness to share such crucial and highly personal and emotional information. Thank you again to everyone!  Love and prayers to all. Elizabeh

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2008 03:36AM Princess1214 wrote: Sheila, Thank you for your reply.  I was afraid I was over reactining.  I am 48 and soon to be 49 (this month) and I have 3 kids (17, 13, and 9)...all I could do was think of them and felt that I needed to be ontop of things. Elizabeth
